attributes.action: Remove ability of employer to make employee to opt out of 48 hours week
attributes.additional_details: Hospitality and catering staff is forced to sign a form to opt out of 48 hours working week, working excessive hours every week, not getting paid overtime and it effects their mental and physical health seriously.
attributes.background: Remove ability of employer to make employee to opt out of 48 hours week. Please make 48 hours week compulsory for Hospitality and catering staff.

rejection.details:
Employees can choose to work more than 48 hours a week by opting out, and your employer can ask you to opt out, but you can’t be sacked or treated unfairly for refusing to do so: https://www.gov.uk/maximum-weekly-working-hours/weekly-maximum-working-hours-and-opting-out

If what you want is for the Government to remove the ability of employees to opt out of working more than 48 hours a week, we could accept a petition requesting this.
